meanings.definition: To make traditional or conform to tradition.
meanings.sent1: She traditionalized the family recipe by adding a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent2: The museum traditionalized the exhibit by showcasing ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: He traditionalized his morning routine by always wearing his lucky socks.
meanings.sent4: The small town was traditionalized by the annual folklore festival.
meanings.sent5: The old book was traditionalized with handwritten notes in the margins.

meanings.definition: To give a traditional character to.
meanings.sent1: The artist traditionalized the modern painting with classic techniques.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony was traditionalized with the lighting of candles.
meanings.sent3: She traditionalized her outfit by wearing a vintage hat.
meanings.sent4: The new restaurant traditionalized the menu with old family recipes.
meanings.sent5: The holiday decorations traditionalized the house with festive colors.

meanings.definition: To bring under the influence of tradition.
meanings.sent1: The school traditionalized the students by teaching cultural customs.
meanings.sent2: The community traditionalized the newcomers with local traditions.
meanings.sent3: He traditionalized his friends by introducing them to traditional music.
meanings.sent4: The festival traditionalized the attendees with traditional dances.
meanings.sent5: The story traditionalized the reader with ancient legends.
